title: Google Classroom now supports exporting missing and excused grades to select Student Information Systems (SIS)
summary: Google Classroom now allows teachers to include missing and excused grades when exporting grades to their Student Information Systems (SIS).  This update provides increased flexibility in grading assignments and classwork.  Previously, only returned grades could be exported.

title: Gemini models are coming to GitHub Copilot
summary: GitHub Copilot is integrating Google's Gemini 1.5 Pro model, offering developers a choice of AI models for code generation, analysis, and optimization.  Gemini 1.5 Pro boasts a long context window, enabling processing of extensive codebases.  The model will be selectable via a new model picker in Copilot, rolling out in the coming weeks.

title: Beyond Round Robin: Achieving True Traffic Balance across Instances in GCP
summary: A client migrating 50% of their workload from Rackspace to GCP's Application Load Balancers (ALBs) experienced uneven traffic distribution, with 70-80% routed to a single zone despite a round-robin policy.  This was due to the ALB prioritizing zones with low utilization (under 10%), leading to imbalanced distribution.  To achieve true traffic balance, the author suggests consulting GCP documentation for alternative configurations or contacting GCP support.

title: Welcome to the Era of Imagined Reality: Introducing Imagen on Vertex AI
summary: Imagen on Vertex AI empowers developers to create cutting-edge AI applications that transform text prompts into high-quality images in mere seconds.  This text-to-image generator offers advanced features including image editing, partial image editing using masks, and image upscaling.  It leverages Google's state-of-the-art generative AI capabilities.

title: Cloud Storage - Release notes
summary: Google Cloud Storage's October 29th, 2024 release notes detail that all Application Load Balancers, except the classic one, now support stateful cookie-based session affinity for improved user experience.  Data Access logs are now compatible with all authenticated browser downloads.  No other significant changes are mentioned in the provided release notes.

title: Stackdriver - Release notes

title: SAP on GCP - Release Notes
summary: The October 29, 2024, Google Cloud release notes detail the general availability of BigQuery Connector for SAP version 2.8, featuring enhancements like field-level record compression and improved HTTP error handling.  Application Load Balancers (excluding the classic version) now support stateful cookie-based session affinity for improved backend stickiness.  Data Access logs are now compatible with all authenticated browser downloads.

title: Cloud Memorystore for Redis - Release notes
summary: The October 29, 2024, Google Cloud Memorystore for Redis release notes detail production updates.  These notes include announcements of new or updated features, bug fixes, known issues, and deprecated functionality.  Regularly checking these release notes ensures users stay informed about the latest changes.

title: Cloud Load Balancing - Release notes
summary: Google Cloud's October 29, 2024, Cloud Load Balancing release notes detail the general availability of stateful cookie-based session affinity for Application Load Balancers (excluding the classic version).  This allows for persistent connections to backend servers.  Additionally, Data Access logs are now compatible with all authenticated browser downloads.

title: Kubernetes Engine - Release Notes
summary: The Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) release notes for October 29, 2024, detail version updates.  Rollouts of these updates begin on the release date and take several business days to complete across all Google Cloud zones.  Specific version numbers and changes are included in the release notes.

title: Secure Your GKE Services with Auth0 , Identity-Aware Proxy and the Gateway API
summary: This article details how to enhance the security of Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) services.  It uses Auth0 for authentication, Identity-Aware Proxy (IAP) for access control, and the Gateway API for managing ingress.  The combination provides a robust and secure access management system for GKE applications.

title: Stop Thinking in Data Pipelines, Think in Data Platforms: Introducing the Analytics Engineering…
summary: The Analytics Engineering Framework (AEF) aims to create a data platform deployable in minutes, enabling data practitioners to build complex pipelines independently.  This addresses challenges with maintaining data pipelines, such as high engineering costs and a centralized bottleneck.  AEF offers a standardized, scalable solution for building robust and cost-effective data platforms on Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
